Reviews.Title: Similar to the Z30, but better for one reason
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I love Fuji cameras - and no, I'm not a Fuji employee, but maybe I should be - I would love an employee discount!  This Z37 was a deal I couldn't refuse and I believe this is my 10th Fuji digital camera I've purchased since 2004.  I got the purple color and it's beautiful.I owned the Z30 Fujifilm FinePix Z30 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Whirl White) previously, but at the last minute I decided to gift it to a young relative of mine only because of one thing I disliked about it: On the Z30 the USB plug-in was located INSIDE the camera's battery compartment.  I feared the latch would eventually break off since the USB plug, the battery and the memory card were all in the same area.Instead, the Z37 Fuji has the USB plug on the SIDE of the camera.  In addition, this is a multi-use plug.  With the Z37 you get an AC adapter cable in addition to the USB cable.  The AC adapter charges the battery inside the camera.  So unless I'm removing the memory card on this camera, there is no reason to open the battery compartment.The AC adapter replaces the separate battery charger that comes with the Z30.  This also means if your battery runs low, you can use the Z37 with it plugged into an outlet, but of course, this does limit what you can take a picture of, unless it's something near the electric outlet.The Z37 is slightly thinner than the Z30 but otherwise they appear to be the same.  Same LCD size, and the buttons are located in the same configuration.  The LCD is big and bright - I have no trouble seeing anything outside in the bright sun. It's tiny and lightweight and easy to carry in either a pocket or small bag - it weighs slightly over 4 ounces.And since the lens has a cover - and this is the way the camera is powered on/off - by sliding the lens cover open (like the first Fuji digital cameras invented) you almost don't need to buy a separate case....although I do keep mine in a case because I don't like the exterior to get scratched.Just one complaint with this camera, otherwise it's perfect.  There is no good area to hold onto the camera. The entire back is composed of LCD screen and buttons. At least the back area is rubberized so it does help with the grip.But the pro's way outnumber my single complaint:>>> Quick response when opening the lens cover to take the first shot>>> SR Auto - just point and shoot>>> Takes beautiful pictures>>> Fast response time after taking a flash picture>>> Lithium-ion battery - one charge lasts over 200 pictures>>> Takes good videos - better than my expensive Panasonic LumixNote about the videos:  You can't use optical zoom once you start filming, but you can set it before.  You can use digital zoom after you start filming, but you have to turn it on before-hand in the set-up menu.  They aren't HD but they look pretty good.Note about the SR Auto setting:  This setting drains the battery a little quicker, because the lens and sensor is constantly evaluating and focusing whatever you have the camera pointed at - the lens noise is completely normal and nothing to worry about.  If you don't want to hear the lens focusing, just set the camera on regular Auto instead (the picture of the camera icon).In conclusion: This is a good entry-level camera and I recommend it for just about anyone who is looking for an easy to use camera.  Even a young kid. And it's built tougher than it appears - since the lens zooms INSIDE the camera body. Case in point: Two days after I received my Z30, it slipped out of my hands and hit the kitchen floor (my condo is built on a slab). I thought the camera was broken, but I turned it back on and was none worse for the wear. Not even a scratch.  This Z37 appears to be built just as tough as the Z30 which I dropped.It comes with just 18 MB of internal memory, so pick up an SD card if you don't already have one.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mercy Lopez "yadi"
Reviews.Content: This camera is small enough to carry everywhere and it gets better! It takes pictures quickly with high resolution. The lens is inside the camera so you won't have to worry whether you will break the lens if you drop it ( i dropped my Nikon camera on accident and immediately broke the lens). It is really a fun camera to have as well an simple. The buttons are sealed so that any dirt or water wont go through and ruin the camera or the button. I would recommend this camera to anyone that is looking for a cute portable camera that takes great shots.

Reviews.Title: This is a screamin' deal on an entry level camera!
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: I am a bit of a camera nut and have a few, none would be described as entry-level.  After loads of research, I bought two of these cameras for my teenage granddaughters; it will be a first for both of them.  I was skeptical when I ordered, that a camera in this price range could actually have any substance but I was more than pleasantly surprised when the cameras arrived.  I charged them up and have been playing with them all afternoon (so I can help the girls with the learning curve, of course) and am having a blast with them.  Now I want one for myself, even though I don't need it! I'm not saying that this will produce the results that a higher end camera will, but it is tiny, loaded with features and will be perfect as a starter camera.  Everything outlined in the description is there as described and easy to access if you are even a little bit familiar with how cameras work these days - no manual necessary to start having loads of fun! At this price, I think you would be hard pressed to find a match.

Reviews.Title: Great portable and inexpensive camera!
Reviews.Author: Giorgi G. "Giorgi"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for most occasions. It is definitely not the best in terms of picture quality, but then again, if you want to get more, you have to spend a lot more. For the money, this is a great every-day-use camera.Pros:+ Light weight+ Inexpensive+ Good looking+ 3x zoom without a protruding lenseCons:- Not the best image quality, but still good for most occasions- Auto ISO only, but an every day user would not touch those adjustments anyways

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm Finepix Z37
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 8 year old daughter. She Loves it. The color is vibrant and the picture quality is wonderful. For the price and for what it is this camera is a great purchase. I would recommend and, in fact, bought myself and my other daughter one as well.

Reviews.Title: Was a GREAT GIFT to give!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I own 2 Fugi cameras, and they are great so I decided to buy one for a friend for Christmas.  My friend is a long haul truck driver and she loves to take pictures of the good ol USA.  She has told me how easy this camera is to use, and she's not the most technical savy person, but she loves it.  She emails me pictures from all over the US and they are beautiful.  So if you are considering an easy to use camera that takes beautiful pictures take a look at this camera, you won't be disappointed in the Fugifilm Finepix Z37.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: S. Reddish "loves spooky books"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use.  It comes on when you slide open to reveal the lens.  As someone is is not up on electronics, I used to hate to use my old camera.  By the time I figured out how to use it, a lot of the times, the moment I wanted to capture was over.  Thanks for this great camera.  It was also delivered super fast in perfect condtion.

Reviews.Title: My Daughter Loves it
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Maslowski
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter  (teenager)  . this product met both of our requirements. 1) The photo quality is great 2) The lens is protected when the camera is off. Not just retracted, protected! 3) Cost, There's real value here for the money it's terrific. 4) Ease of use, the menu controls are wonderfully laid out and are a breeze to use. 4) She wanted a cool color. I could have spent five times the money on something else and she would not been as happy.  5) Size,  It is a tiny camera. it will fit in a pocket or a purse without a problem. 6) memory, uses inexpensive SD media with an internal rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Low quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Portia Taalib
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter, she loved the color and that it had a rechagable battery. There was also some cool things you can do with the photos. However the picture quality was horrible. The pictues were too bright. No matter how much tweeking I did, the pictures came out the same. It looked like the camera focus a clear shot right before the camera snaped, but the pictures still came out too bright.  To think this is suppose to be a 10 mega pixle camera. No exaggeration, my phone camera actually took better pictures than this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: conservativemom
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 7 year old daughter after extensive research on the internet of various brands, models and price ranges. I was looking for something with durability, ease of use and a rechargeable battery. This camera had it all... and it came in purple, something my daughter insisted on in a camera. The lens remains protected and does not protrude out when the camera is turned on, a great feature for a 7-year old who is apt to drop or bump the camera at some time in the future. The Finepix Z37 is VERY simple to use and I would highly recommend to anyone who does not want to sift through all the complicated features and buttons of a pricier camera. The charging process is simpler than most, the cable just attaches to the camera, no separate battery charger needed and the battery does not need to be removed from the camera to be charged. We are very happy with it. The camera does everything you'd want in a digital (even movies!) and I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Ms. ABC
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an inexpensive point-and-shoot that takes great pictures of your family, you won't be disappointed. I upgraded from the Z30, which was fine. But the Z37 takes much clearer pictures. And for those of us who enjoy beautiful objects, this camera is absolutely GORGEOUS!! Makes me happy just holding it!

Reviews.Title: my first digital
Reviews.Author: Kinichi
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of months now and I'm thrilled with it. I just learned to download pics on the internet & I'm like a kid in a candy store. I was a little surprised at small it is but that makes it pretty easy to carry around. You can put it anywhere. It could be worn as a necklace!!! It takes great pics & I love the timer feature. I'm extremely happy with the camera. Small price for a fabulous camera. I'm learning new things about it all the time. I got the blue one. It's just the cutest thing & I love it.

Reviews.Title: Similar to the Z30, but better for one reason
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I love Fuji cameras - and no, I'm not a Fuji employee, but maybe I should be - I would love an employee discount!  This Z37 was a deal I couldn't refuse and I believe this is my 10th Fuji digital camera I've purchased since 2004.  I got the purple color and it's beautiful.I owned the Z30 previously, but at the last minute I decided to gift it to a young relative of mine only because of one thing I disliked about it: On the Z30 the USB plug-in was located INSIDE the camera's battery compartment.  I feared the latch would eventually break off since the USB plug, the battery and the memory card were all in the same area.Instead, the Z37 Fuji has the USB plug on the SIDE of the camera.  In addition, this is a multi-use plug.  With the Z37 you get an AC adapter cable in addition to the USB cable.  The AC adapter charges the battery inside the camera.  So unless I'm removing the memory card on this camera, there is no reason to open the battery compartment.The AC adapter replaces the separate battery charger that comes with the Z30.  This also means if your battery runs low, you can use the Z37 with it plugged into an outlet, but of course, this does limit what you can take a picture of, unless it's something near the electric outlet.The Z37 is slightly thinner than the Z30 but otherwise they appear to be the same.  Same LCD size, and the buttons are located in the same configuration.  The LCD is big and bright - I have no trouble seeing anything outside in the bright sun. It's tiny and lightweight and easy to carry in either a pocket or small bag - it weighs slightly over 4 ounces.And since the lens has a cover - and this is the way the camera is powered on/off - by sliding the lens cover open (like the first Fuji digital cameras invented) you almost don't need to buy a separate case....although I do keep mine in a case because I don't like the exterior to get scratched.Just one complaint with this camera, otherwise it's perfect.  There is no good area to hold onto the camera. The entire back is composed of LCD screen and buttons. At least the back area is rubberized so it does help with the grip.But the pro's way outnumber my single complaint:>>> Quick response when opening the lens cover to take the first shot>>> SR Auto - just point and shoot>>> Takes beautiful pictures>>> Fast response time after taking a flash picture>>> Lithium-ion battery - one charge lasts over 200 pictures>>> Takes good videos - better than my expensive Panasonic LumixNote about the videos:  You can't use optical zoom once you start filming, but you can set it before.  You can use digital zoom after you start filming, but you have to turn it on before-hand in the set-up menu.  They aren't HD but they look pretty good.Note about the SR Auto setting:  This setting drains the battery a little quicker, because the lens and sensor is constantly evaluating and focusing whatever you have the camera pointed at - the lens noise is completely normal and nothing to worry about.  If you don't want to hear the lens focusing, just set the camera on regular Auto instead (the picture of the camera icon).In conclusion: This is a good entry-level camera and I recommend it for just about anyone who is looking for an easy to use camera.  Even a young kid. And it's built tougher than it appears - since the lens zooms INSIDE the camera body. Case in point: Two days after I received my Z30, it slipped out of my hands and hit the kitchen floor (my condo is built on a slab). I thought the camera was broken, but I turned it back on and was none worse for the wear. Not even a scratch.  This Z37 appears to be built just as tough as the Z30 which I dropped.It comes with just 18 MB of internal memory, so pick up an SD card if you don't already have one.

Reviews.Title: Description of camera is incorrect
Reviews.Author: shars39
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter (age 8) from the Easter Bunny.  It was not until Easter Sunday after she received the camera did I notice that this camera DOES NOT TAKE AA BATTERIES as stated in the description on Amazon.  The description listed on Amazon for Fujifilm Finepix Z37 states this camera "powered by AA batteries (included)."  That was one of several reasons I selected this camera for my daughter.  The camera takes battery NP-45 not AA batteries!  I contemplated returning the camera but how could I take back the camera from my daughter who was totally excited and can't stop taking picture with it?The camera is easy to operate.  My daughter loves the mini clips she can record. This is a good starter camera.I would have rated this camera with 4 stars but deducted a star due to the error in the description posted on Amazon and the fact that the camera takes NP-45 battery and not AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Buy it.
Reviews.Author: T. Reynolds "Amazon Freak"
Reviews.Content: For the price this camera is great.  it's super small, has lots of options and the pic quality is pretty darn good.  Plus it's purple :)  very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Better than the old
Reviews.Content: So, the last camera i had was a digital polaroid touch screen. It was a good camera, until i broke it. So i had to find a new one quickly. I saw this one and was interested in it because of its funky color and it was cheap! (im only 12) so i ordered it the next day. This camera is really good! ive taken awesome pictures with it outside. Very easy to use also. The only bad thing about it is if your inside andyou dont have the flash on the pictures can be blurry. i'll post some pictures i took with this camera on my account so feel free to look at anymore pictures! :)

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Desiree Jones
Reviews.Content: This camera is a really good camera. The pictures it takes are crystal clear. Usually if you take a picture without flash, the picture will have a orange tint to it, and it's a little fuzzy. I'm very big on taking videos, and this camera takes the most amazing videos. The only thing I don't like, is you can't zoom in or out while shooting a video.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My dad bought me this camera for my great grades and it is amazing!!!!!!! I love the size and battery life! It is great for taking pictures of my dog and freinds! The only thing im having trouble with is how to change the color of the pics like to black and white for instance but thats perfectly fine!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Similar to the Z30, but better for one reason
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I love Fuji cameras - and no, I'm not a Fuji employee, but maybe I should be - I would love an employee discount! If you don't want to hear the lens focusing, just set the camera on regular Auto instead (the picture of the camera icon).In conclusion: This is a good entry-level camera and I recommend it for just about anyone who is looking for an easy to use camera.  Even a young kid. And it's built tougher than it appears - since the lens zooms INSIDE the camera body. Case in point: Two days after I received my Z30, it slipped out of my hands and hit the kitchen floor (my condo is built on a slab). I thought the camera was broken, but I turned it back on and was none worse for the wear. Not even a scratch.  This Z37 appears to be built just as tough as the Z30 which I dropped.It comes with just 18 MB of internal memory, so pick up an SD card if you don't already have one.

Reviews.Title: great camera for young photographer
Reviews.Author: C. Bonney
Reviews.Content: Haven't presented this gift to my 8 year-old granddaughter yet, but having reviewed the manual and played with it myself, I think this is going to be a wonderful camera for her. It's sturdy and easy to use, even for small fingers and someone who wears glasses.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gift
Reviews.Author: jackmn
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our 13 yr old daughter and she LOVES it!  The color is what caught our attention ( purple is her lastest crave ) and the color was very vibrant and bright!  The quality is good and the size is perfect.  She had no trouble using it, very easy for her.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Small camera CRAPPY PICTURES
Reviews.Author: sm
Reviews.Content: I had a previous model of this camera that I had for four years - i LOVED IT. So when my kids dropped it and it broke I quickly got online to purchase another camera. I ordered model and have been unhappy ever since. If I could return it I would but I waited to long. The pictures come out horrible. THey are discolored, blurry or can't be used. And I am an avid picture taker (novice but still all the time) I never go anywhere with out my camera. It bothers me so much because I take and use my pictures for personal and work use. It is upsetting.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Fiona Shreck
Reviews.Content: I just got this little purple camera(Santa came early) The pictures are wonderful. Clear crisp. Child friendly. Let's see how my eclipse pics from this morning turn out.

Reviews.Title: Will not charge
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: Would be a decent camera if it would charge!  Had to ship it back to Fuji at my cost to ship as I was at day 31 and Amazon would not take it back.  After 2 months, got a new one back from Fuji and it charged a total of 1 time...  Now I'm stuck with a non-functioning camera again.  Ordered a external battery charger today through Ebay as it was cheaper to do that then to play these games for the rest of my life!  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Ektarama
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom and had it sent to her. She had numerous problems with it but she's 82. The buttons were too small for her for one thing, but most troubling for her was she told me the screen is almost impossible to see if using it outdoors.I checked it out and had no problems with the buttons and controls, but as others have mentioned here you can't see the screen in outdoor light even with the brightness cranked up, and there is no viewfinder so one just has to aim it and hope for the best.This wouldn't be a big deal for me considering how inexpensive it is and my mom said she would live with it, but if I had paid more I would probably return it and get something else.It's definitely small and seems to be put together well. In general I like Fuji products. I have an older Fuji digital and the screen is much easier to see in daylight so I think they missed the mark with this one.

Reviews.Title: 2nd time buyer of this camera...
Reviews.Author: Roze
Reviews.Content: I first bought this camera after my high school graduation in 2009. I got it at Walmart for $250 and it was worth every penny of it. I loved it! The pictures were very crisp and clear. The camera itself is on the small side. It's somewhat thin and easy to hide in your pocket, perfect for sneak attacks. Haha. I'm one of those people who love to take pictures of anything and everything and this camera does the job beautifully. School events, birthdays, nature, action photos, and profile pics are all easy to take with it. The video feature was pretty cool too although I didn't mess with it that much. The only difference between the 2 is that my 1st camera was orange. Anyways my camera came up missing last fall and I liked it so much I bought it again. And it's cheaper this time! :D

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Low Price
Reviews.Author: Num47 "Ray A"
Reviews.Content: This camera I bought before my road trip back east beacause...well my other camera just wouldn't work. So I got this one because it was relatively cheap and seemed pretty reliable to me; except for the color, I'm a dude and purple just isn't my thing. But getting back to the camera, I found it very responsive when I saw something along the road and needed to take a quick picture of whatever it was and I was very pleased with the picture quality. The camera is very light weight and very compact, just a tad wider than my lg rumor 2 phone. I also must say that it's pretty durable to because while on vacation, I dropped it down a flight of stone stairs at my friends house and when we looked at it, everything was fine except for a few scratches! Overall, if your looking for a quick, responsive, reliable camera for someone in their teens, this is it!

Reviews.Title: Good Choice
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: I really like my camera so far. I have not used it much as I have not had time off work yet. But I do like the quality of the pictures that I have took.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: olotsodogs
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for a while for an inexpensive camera to replace my old Vivitar, but every camera I found that had good reviews was over $100.The Vivitar I had is very confusing, and most of what I needed was buried in the menu.  I no longer have the manual, so I frequently ended up with effects that I did not want because I couldnt figure out the controls.  It also ate batteries at an alarming rate.I found this camera at a VERY good price, and the reviews were favorable, so I ordered it.I LOVE it!I love the size - its about half the size of my old camera.I love the rechargeable batteries - no more hunting for AA batteries.I love the simplicity....if I want to take a video, I simply press the video button, and press it again to end the video.  The camera uses a format that can easily be uploaded to the internet (which my old Vivitar did not).If I want to take a picture, I simply slide the cover open, look into the nice large screen, and snap.I love the automatic features - I am usually taking pictures of my foster dogs for the shelter website, and, of course, they tend to move when I snap the picture.  This camera captures them anyway, and adjusts the color nicely regardless of the light.I do have the manual for this camera, but I havent even needed it yet. I have already take new pics, taken a video and uploaded it to the shelter website, all from just studying the buttons.The only thing I DONT love is the software.  It is glitchy (when I loaded it onto my computer it immediately quit working, and asked me to download a fix for it).  Its not intuitive, and I havent been able to dowload anything with the cable yet.But thats okay - I just removed my card from the old camera, put it in the new one, and avoided the whole issue by using the software I already had.

Reviews.Title: Cute camera!
Reviews.Author: Hoku
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 10 year old daughter.  She was so happy to see how cute the camera was.  It's a light colored, metallic purple.  Very pretty.  It's also compact and light.  It has lots of features and she loves the video feature.  The best part about this camera is that it has it's own rechargeable battery. Paid $70 from a store through Amazon.  I was lucky to get this super great price.  Plus I received free shipping through Amazon.  Amazon always packs products well and ships very quick.  I love buying through Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera with a few flaws
Reviews.Author: Bookilicious
Reviews.Content: This camera is great in some ways, but lacks in other ways.  First of all, it's the perfect size and is very user friendly.  It takes very clear close-up shots and works well in daylight.  However, allow me to outline some of the drawbacks.1. The glare on the screen is so bad that it's nearly impossible to see in sunlight.  Also, I've noticed that pictures which look very blurry on the screen tend to show up clear on my computer, so the viewing screen leaves a little to be desired.2. This camera does not take pictures at night.  There is a night setting on the camera, and I had a Canon that took great night pics, so I was really disappointed that this one doesn't work at all on the night setting.3. In very bright sunlight, the corners of the picture will look dark because of the reflection.  In other words the lens is placed inside the casing just enough that there is a shadow on the corners of a picture when the sun is very bright.  This has happened without fail on all my beach pics with this camera.4. I'm not sure if this is user error or not, but when the SD card is reformatted, the file names go back to 0001.  So when I import the pics from the camera into iPhoto, half the pics in iPhoto have the same file name which is a huge pain when I'm transferring them to folders later on.  I never had this problem with my Canon, so this was another feature I was disappointed with.All in all, this is a nice little $69.99 camera.  However, were I making the choice again, I probably would have saved my money and invested in something of a little higher quality with more desirable features.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm finepix - not really new
Reviews.Author: Goldengirl
Reviews.Content: Fuji Finepix was marked "NEW" & marketed as "NEW".  The fine print on sellers info said OPENED buy not used.  OPENED for what reason?? To try it out & look at it?? That is used, believe it or not.  Everything had been opened, protective film removed.  Battery out of plastic, oh yeah!! You've got to be kidding.  Then, the final blow--- the front was scratched in over 6 places, like it had been dropped & damaged.  Extremely disappointing and we got stuck paying the return shipment of $5.00- I asked for $5 back and no reply from seller or Amazon. A total ripoff & deceitful selling of "NEW" products.IF ELECTRONICS ARE OPENED & SCRATCHED -- IT IS NOT NEW.

Reviews.Title: simple camera
Reviews.Author: E. Townsend "Betsi"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use.  It's compact and lightweight  the picture quality is good, you can easily change it as needed.  And the video function is also very simple - one button on & off.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: L. Wordsworth
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great price for the quality.  It was used, with some signs of wear, so the price was reasonable and appropriate.

Reviews.Title: We Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: gus
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these as a Xmas gift for my wife. I liked it so much I got one for myself. It is so nice and compact and takes very good photos with a minimum of fuss, point and click. I carry it in my shirt pocket, it isn't any larger than a smart phone. The best feature is the lens cover, that alone is worth the price. I really don't like the currently popular telescoping lens designs, they are just asking to be damaged and use a lot more battery power.Unfortunately a dog decided my wife's camera was tasty and destroyed it. When looking for a replacement we discovered it was being discontinued but found some on Amazon. We bought two, one as her replacement and one as a spare because I could find no other camera with the same design.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera good price
Reviews.Author: SAD DAD
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a back-up for our "Fujifilm Finepix Z20fd 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom". It has fewer options but takes excellent pictures and is LINUX friendly. Very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Okay but cheap.
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap camera so the picture quality shows it. It's super easy for the photo to blur unless its a picture of a statue that wont flinch. It is satisfactory but the picture quality is not exactly excellent.

Reviews.Title: Did not last long
Reviews.Author: S. Hays
Reviews.Content: I got this camera about a year ago and it does not work anymore. I take good care of my things and I have never dropped the camera or let anyone else use it. I keep getting a card error note on the screen and yet when I use the card in other cameras they work fine. I have tried several cards and it is the same with all of them. I even bought a new card and formatted it and the same error note came up. I am disappointed because I wanted a small camera for parties, etc.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: S. Rowlands "a.k.a. Haley"
Reviews.Content: I really love the color on this camera and the functions. One of the other things I love about this camera is the way the buttons are arranged. It makes using this camera so easy, I can do it with my eyes closed. The only thing I don't like about this camera is that it is not waterproof. If you are not looking for a waterproof camera, this is the one for you!

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera for an unbelievable price!
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect.  It's compact, takes great quality pictures and the battery lasts the longest out of any digital camera I have ever had.  I have had it for 3 weeks and only fully charged it once - it still has battery life!  I definitely recommend this as a choice that is attractive & usefull without putting a dent in your budget.  I am very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Value For The Money
Reviews.Author: susieb "susieb"
Reviews.Content: I am a point and shoot kind of girl.  I like a good value and this camera is just my speed.  It is easy to use and takes great photos.  You won't feel bad either when you have to replace it with all the new technology coming out so quickly. I use a very similar one to upload photos onto Ebay and it works great.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I hoped for. I can easily see the buttons and use them to take the type of picture I am trying to take. Very convenient size, easy to take everyday-just in case! Very good pictures, especially for this priced camera. Have had more expensive cameras that I could not see to use! and never had with me due to their size! This one is always with me ready to go! Thanks Fuji!

Reviews.Title: Tough little camera!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Barta
Reviews.Content: I already own this camera and I bought this one for my daughter. The camera feels light and toy-like, but don't let that fool you. This is a durable camera.I have owned a Nikon coolpix, my friend went through 2 and my sister went through 2 in 1 year- because that 'solid' camera breaks if you look at it wrong! My friend has had the Finepix for 3 years and just throws it in her purse, along with all of her other junk. Another friend bought it the same time I did and she loves it too. As with any camera, you need some basic skills to take pictures. Might be worth your time to read a few picture taking basics. I have people thinking that some of the pictures I took with my Finepix are pictures I took with my $700 DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat Disappointed
Reviews.Author: E. Pumphrey "Sew Happy"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fuji Finepix Z37 to replace an older Fuji I had. I expected the new camera to give me a better quality photo, since the megapixels were higher than what I had previous. Not so! I am disappointed in the photo sharpness, and would be returning it except my window for returns (30 DAYS) has passed. Currently I am shopping for another camera, and will be giving this one to my child. I like everything about it EXCEPT the photos!

Reviews.Title: surprising quality!
Reviews.Author: C. Ugarte "open minded"
Reviews.Content: Anytime I shop for an electronic, I do a lot of research. Digital camera's are just one of those things that if you don't read reviews and compare, you may end up with something... crappy. Well I ended up buying this lil guy and I adore it!There are plenty of picture modes, and you really should go through them. I recently used the party mode for Halloween in a very dark room, and the pictures are clear and bright! You also have to learn what each mode is capable of in order to get the picture to be crisp and clear. Without the right mode you do end up with a blurry photo.The Macro is magnificent but make sure the object is really tiny since this baby can take really good shots of tiny details without it. The autofocus is very helpful too, but don't let go of that button until it's stopped focusing!You can't be mad at the rechargeable battery. It's another big reason why I chose this one. Most camera's with disposable batteries just don't have a long life. This rechargeable battery can laaaast. I can't really say how long, but I will say that after a night of shooting pics, I didn't have to recharge until the 3rd time I used it...I only have two complaints. The first is the actual buttons. They are really soft, and even though I haven't had any problems yet, I'm a bit scared that I won't be able to push them in the future. Think remote control buttons... The second is the on/off which is just a sliding door. It's not so bad, but if you slide it into your pocket the wrong way it does turn on. Atleast it does have an automatic shut off feature if you haven't pressed any buttons...All in all, I do like this camera. I'm glad I picked it. and it's bluuuue!

Reviews.Title: Great design, lousy photos
Reviews.Author: Word Sorceress "wordsorceress"
Reviews.Content: I loved the design of this camera. I like that the lens doesn't extend out when you turn the camera on, and the protective lens cover doubling as an on/off switch is genius. The camera was easy to use out of the box without needing to read the instructions. The one-touch video recording is great. But, there remained one fundamental problem for me, which is why I am returning the camera: whether I took photos indoors or outdoors, under bright light or dim light, at least 80% of the photos were not in sharp focus (even using the scene recognition mode). I guess that's what you get if you spend less than $100 on a camera? I was disappointed that it did not live up to the glowing reviews I read on the site. I really wanted to like the camera, but if it can't reliably take good pictures, then I can't justify keeping it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Peg
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my 17 year old, and she loves it.  It is very small (and purple) and is easy to use quickly.  She is able to take action shots, uploading with ease and likes the features available.  We did add a case and it would be a good addition in a package.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: tonya miller
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter and she loved the color. It works great and is very portable!  I like that there is no on / off button but simply slide the front open and you are ready for pictures. Also, it is nice that it is rechargeable and you don't have to change batteries constantly.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a steal!
Reviews.Author: PattyG
Reviews.Content: For $80, you get what you pay for. Maybe more. It's very portable. It takes great pictures & the camera has great focus. Not too many features but it's enough for $80. I'm happy with it. & I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a great camera on a budget. Great for college students.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Suzaque
Reviews.Content: This little camera is very easy to use right out of the box. The pictures are great!

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Terry Mann "Gadget Guru"
Reviews.Content: This is my secod FinePix camera and I really like the Fuji.  Recording audio bits with saved photos is a really cool feature.  The camera looks great and it's very small, almost too small.  The buttons are tiny.  That is my only, minor issue with this, otherwise great camera.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I paid for, maybe more!
Reviews.Author: AAP "USMC"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last night. I was in need of one after breaking my third Sony T-series in a row. I just wanted something that could take pictures of decent quality and could record video. I bought it at a military store so it came with a bundle including a memory card, reader and a soft case.PROsThere's two main things that this camera surprised me on:- The specs it has for such a small amount ($$$) is surprising. I'm used to paying greater amounts for less with Sony. I'm a big Sony fan. Or was...- I'm not big on portability as a main sell point, I'll sacrifice space if it pays off with quality and with results. However, this tiny camera fits in the palm of my hand and weighs a very small amount. And was definitely a great addition to the already surprising specifications.CONs- Much like the other review that offered a 1 star I too had a problem with the shutter speed and flash delay. Something that is a small inconvenience and/or can be fixed if you go through the options of the camera instead of giving up on it. I changed the settings and it's good now. And by doing so I now know the inner menus of the camera a whole lot better.- The battery sliding lid seems to be a little too loose for my taste. However, it might be my specific camera and not the model. Just a small incovenience.OVERALLGreat camera that packs a punch for what you pay. As long as you work on it and try to make it work it will. Good buy!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda C. Nieto
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift for my birthday in the summer. I was excited with the color but my excitement stopped there.  The first thing I noticed is that the camera would not turn off when the lens was covered the picture display would pop up. At first I wasn't bothered by this but my camera would make random weird noises in my purse and the battery would drain if I forgot to take it out when it was not in use. It's difficult for an average camera user to take a picture. It takes forever to snap a picture. I took this camera to Lollapolooza and it took awful awful pictures by the last day of the show I stopped taking the camera with me because it was pointless. I saw several cameras above the crowd taking pictures and no one seemed to have a problem focusing or getting the outdoor lighting right. This camera doesn't focus properly, it is defective, and it is small but oddly bulky. [...]I've had with a Fuji product. I will never be dumb enough to purchase a Fuji in any capacity again.

Reviews.Title: Fugi camera
Reviews.Author: ----Arlene Anderson "shopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandaughter, this is her first digital camera, she likes it alot, it is easy to use and the pictures print great!

Reviews.Title: Good for indoor pictures only
Reviews.Author: I Know It
Reviews.Content: This tiny camera is good only for indoor pictures. I took this camera to the beach, I tried to take pictures: it was impossible. I had liked to know it's good for indoors. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Effulgent.Unicorn
Reviews.Content: Got it as an early birthday present in June. I picked it out. I loved it so much. Upon first opening it, the color isn't exactly as it looks on the site, or the box, but its good. Absolutely LOVE the one button video! It takes great pictures in every setting I used it in (well except when it was almost pitch black outside, but thats every camera). It was so amazing. I took it on vacation in early July to Silverthorne Colorado area. One one of the last days we were there, I noticed it wasn't in the van as we were going to Breckenridge. I figured I didn't need it that day, and didn't think about it. But when we got back to the condo we rented and it wasn't there, I was really sad. I must have lost it either at the Royal Gorge or at a resturant called McClelands that we went to the day before. I miss it so much. All the pictures I took were not on my computer yet. Overall it was a very sad story and I still miss it. My accual birthday was yesterday, and I am looking at this camera again. I knew from the minute I lost it I wanted another one. I see now that it is $10 more than when I got it the first time. I doubt my parents are buying it again, and I am seriously wanting to spend my own money on it this time. Thats how much I liked it. The only thing feature wise that disappointed me was that you can't set the shutter speed manually. This means I couldn't make those cool light pictures, but my mom's camera does that so everything is okay. Other than that one tiny thing, I LOVE IT! One more thing!! I had this for almost a month of almost non-stop picture taking, and other than the orriginal charge-up, I only had to carge it like Once!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera. It is very cute and stylish and fits my needs perfectly. The only complaint I have is that the pictures don't always turn out how they are displayed on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Great Form Factor, poor camera
Reviews.Author: C. Davis
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas. She wanted a really small, light pocketable camera. Fuji designed a great small chic form factor, but apparently forgot that taking decent pictures was important to people who buy cameras. There were two main issues with this camera--shutter lag and blur.The shutter lag was horrible, especially with the flash turned on. I know there is a red-eye reduction feature, but no way that I could figure out to turn it off. It was impossible to capture the image you wanted because it would take a picture a second after you push the button.Almost every picture we took indoors was blurry. If the subject was not standing perfectly still through the horribly long lag, they would be blurry. There was a blur warning on the screen, but the manual did not give any way to correct it.In short if you are looking for a small light camera, look somewhere else. I took this back and got her a Canon SD 780 IS Digital Elph, and she is much happier with it. It is just as small and can actually be used to take decent pictures in a wide variety of situations.

Reviews.Title: Good value, but won't charge or transfer files
Reviews.Author: FTM
Reviews.Content: At just over $100, this camera is a nice value, but the USB cable (or maybe the camera itself) doesn't work for transferring pictures or charging the battery.  It was easy to work around this with the purchase of a card reader and an external battery charger, but be prepared for these extra expenses.  In general, the camera feels a little cheap, which probably isn't surprising for the money.  Despite its flaws, it's an attractive camera with great features for the money.
